title: Production Assembler
job_description:
We are looking for motivated assemblers to join our Production Assembly/Final Parts Assembly team and contribute to the completion of our quality products.

Job Summary: This role is responsible for joining our production team in the final  
stages of assembling  
larger high-end workout equipment, combining the necessary components and  
preparing items for shipping.

Key Responsibilities:

Kitting:

  • Review product orders to collect items and accurately maintain  
the production schedule

  • Track and report any missing or defective parts needed for products

Quality Control:

  • Analyze and assess quality of items, identifying any inconsistencies or defects

  • Ensure that the final assembled products are prepped appropriately for shipping and handling

Calibration:

  • Gain a thorough understanding of company product line, including specifications and features of equipment

  • Ensure the assembled products are consistent with standards  
and functioning properly

General:

  • Utilizing tools such as drills, screwdrivers, wrenches, hammers and tape measures to correctly assemble larger equipment

  • Work in a collaborative environment to maintain  
production flow and achieve common goals

Skills:

  • Manual dexterity

  • Attention to detail

  • Problem solver

  • Strong time management

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment

  • Ability to read drawings

Qualifications:

  • High school-level education or equivalent

  • 12 months of production assembly experience

  • Ability to follow directions and listen well

  • Prior experience using basic hand and power tools

  • Ability to lift 20-35 lbs. of material as needed

  • Positive attitude with the ability to take feedback

  • Knowledge of basic safety protocols

  • Excellent attention to detail and quality control

Working Conditions:

  • The role may require standing for extended periods and working with various metal machinery and tools.

  • Personal protective equipment (PPE) will be provided and must be worn as required.

About Us/ Company Overview:

At Gratz, we specialize in crafting high-end products that combine wood, metal, and leather into exceptional works of art. Gratz Pilates is the original manufacturer of Pilates apparatus and the industry's established source for authentic equipment. Our company was started by Frank Gratz in New York City in 1928 as a custom fabrication shop producing industrial design prototypes, architectural metal, furniture and sculpture for many of the world's greatest designers. Our dedication to quality, craftsmanship, and attention to detail sets us apart in the industry.

title: Material Handler 2 - Bindery
job_description:
Company Description  

  • RRD is a leading global provider of marketing, packaging, print, and supply chain solutions that elevate engagement across the complete customer journey. The company offers the industry’s most trusted portfolio of creative execution and world-wide business process consulting, with services designed to lower environmental impact. With 22,000 clients, including 93% of the Fortune 100, and 32,000 employees across 28 countries, RRD brings the expertise, execution, and scale designed to transform customer touchpoints into meaningful moments of impact.

Job Description  

  • Responsible for laying up, feeding or piling down materials at equipment
  • Jog product off counter stacker and stack neatly on skid to assure good running in bindery or mailing department
  • Complete skid flags and packaging slips to ensure accurate tracking
  • Install strapping, bracing, or padding to prevent shifting or damage in transit, using hand tools
  • Attaches identifying tags or labels to materials or marks information on cases, bales, or other containers
  • Stacks or assembles materials into bundles and bands bundles together, using banding machine and clincher
  • May use automated equipment and/or occasionally operate industrial truck or electric hoist to assist in loading or moving materials and products

Disclosure Statement:

The pay range for this role at the noted location is $16.51 to $18.08 per hour. The actual rate of pay offered may vary based upon, but not limited to: education, skills, experience, proficiency, performance, shift, and location. In addition to base salary, depending on the role, the total compensation package may also include overtime, shift differential, call-in, and stand-by pay. RRD offers benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage, paid time off, disability insurance, 401(k) with match, life insurance and other voluntary supplemental insurance coverages, plus tuition assistance, maternity leave, adoption assistance, and employer/partner discounts

Qualifications  

  • Able to stock, move, arrange, and rotate items in accordance with operating instructions
  • Able to complete appropriate forms relating to stock description, quantity, unit of issue, and the labeling requirements for incoming and outgoing materials
  • Good skill in the use of shrink-wrap and strapping equipment, powered lift equipment, pallet jacks, manual dollies, carts or hand trucks and hand tools used in material handling tasks such as hammers, pliers, strapping and stretch wrapping tools and equipment, tape fasteners, metal band sheers and related equipment
  • Good knowledge of general warehouse layout, item identification codes, basic warehouse procedures, and the storage areas in order to be able to place or pull paper stock, signatures and materials in accordance with standard procedures
  • May require experience in operating/using forklift truck

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

RRD is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

title: Seasonal Summer Production Associate
job_description:
Are you looking for a chance to gain valuable, hands-on experience in a cutting-edge manufacturing facility?   

We are accepting applications now for employment opportunities in starting in May and June   

Look no further than Timberlane's seasonal production program! Join our team this spring and summer to be part of exciting projects and learn the ins and outs of manufacturing in our state-of-the-art facility.   

Our program is the perfect opportunity to get involved in various aspects of our manufacturing process and build your resume by working on key projects. With a wide range of backgrounds and interests among our past summer program participants, from engineering to woodworking technology, we welcome anyone with a passion for pursuing a career in manufacturing.   

As a seasonal team member, you'll be an integral part of our production environment, operating woodworking equipment, using hand and power tools to assemble custom exterior shutters, prepping and sanding shutters for the paint room, and inspecting and boxing final products.   

With a Monday through Friday schedule from 6:30 am to 3:00 pm, you'll have plenty of time to explore all that Timberlane has to offer. Join us for an unforgettable experience!

title: Production Associate II
job_description:
The Production Associate II is responsible for performing simple to moderately complex manufacturing assembly and packaging operations using a variety of hand tools, power tool and shop equipment with minimal supervision.   

  • Perform assembly operations according to the provided documentation. Fastens parts together with bolts, screws, rivets, adhesives or other fasteners using a variety of different tools.
  • Operate power tools such as drill presses, sanders and grinders while following strict safety guidelines.
  • Refer to drawings and written procedures on all work to be performed with limited verbal instruction required.
  • Notify supervisor of missing or defective parts and/or tools or equipment problems.
  • Identify product defects and reports them to the supervisor.
  • Keep work area in clean and orderly condition, complying with established 5S standards.
  • Continuously look for ways to improve process flow and eliminate waste.
  • Maintain a safe work environment to prevent on‐the‐job injuries by following and promoting company, OSHA and EPA rules and regulations, implementing machine safeguards, recognizing and reporting safety hazards and follow all safety procedures and standards.
  • Perform other duties as required within the nature and level of work.

Qualifications   
High school diploma or equivalent is preferred and one ﴾1﴿ year of mechanical or assembly experience are required.   
Must be able to read, write, speak and understand basic English. Ability to demonstrate good mechanical aptitude and proficiency in basic math and trigonometry. Ability to communicate and work as a team member. Ability to work independently with minimum supervision. Must be able to stand for the duration of the shift.   
Physical Demand Requirements   
Required to stand, walk or sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move objects up to 35 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

title: General Laborer
job_description:
Overview  
We are seeking dedicated and skilled Laborers to join our dynamic team in a fast-paced facility. The ideal candidate will possess a strong work ethic and experience with power and hand tools. This role is essential in ensuring the smooth operation of our overall production processes. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow within a supportive environment, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities

  • Operate various power tools and hand tools safely and effectively.
  • Assist in the assembly of equipment ensuring quality standards are met.
  • Maintain a clean and organized work area to promote safety and efficiency.
  • Collaborate with team members to meet production goals and deadlines.
  • Operate forklifts to move materials around the warehouse or factory as required.
  • Follow all safety protocols and guidelines to ensure a safe working environment.

Requirements

  • Proven tool knowledge, with experience using power tools and hand tools.
  • Experience operating heavy equipment
  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality workmanship.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment while also being self-motivated.
  • Willingness to learn new skills and adapt to changing production needs.
  • Driver's license
  • Reliable transportation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

  • Opportunities for advancement

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

Supplemental Pay:

  • Bonus opportunities

Work Location: In person

title: Assembler
job_description:
Reliable Equipment & Service Co. is modern and clean tooling, repair, and distribution center looking for Assemblers to be a part of a growing team serving the Power and Utility Industry. If you are mechanically inclined, this is a great opportunity to learn a new trade. We are willing to train!

An employee in this position is expected to:

  • Accurately assemble our product by reading and interpreting drawings, specifications, bill of materials, and other written instructions.
  • Verify correct quantities of component parts and ensure completed items are up to quality and safety standards.
  • Inspect tools and equipment for defects and notify the supervisor of any maintenance or repairs needed.

What would make you a great fit for the role?

  • Familiarity with assembly tools and equipment.
  • Mechanically inclined.
  • Can prioritize and work well in a fast-paced environment.
  • Attentive to detail.
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills.

  • Candidates may also stop by to fill out an application - 301 Ivyland Road in Warminster, PA.

Benefits Summary:

We offer a competitive salary and an excellent benefits package, including medical, dental, vision and prescription. Company paid life insurance and LTD, STD, 401(k) plan with company match, FSA, and HSA accounts. Vacation, Sick Personal days and much more.  

*This is a Safety-sensitive position.

If offered the position, candidate must successfully pass a background check which includes criminal, DMV, and drug testing.

Reliable Equipment is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunities for all people and embraces diversity. Furthermore, Reliable Equipment does not discriminate as Reliable Equipment is an equal opportunity employer. Reliable Equipment does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions), disability, genetics, citizenship status, military service, or any other status protected by law, in matters pertaining to employment opportunities.

title: Electronics Assembler
job_description:
Position Overview:

The Electronics Assembler will support our Production Department by assembling electrical controllers and electronic components, sub-assemblies, and systems for company manufactured products.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Read and interpret complex electrical schematics, as well as some layout drawings, procedures, work instructions, component specifications, and work orders
  • Assemble electrical systems and support structures
  • Position, align, and install subassemblies, wiring, and components such as transformers, inverters, PLCs, and relays on enclosures and sub panels according to wiring schematics
  • Route, secure, interconnect and terminate wiring of equipment mounted devices to control and remote enclosures
  • Inspect and test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in wiring installations
  • Use testing devices such as ohmmeters, voltmeters, digital multimeters, signal generators, semiconductor testers, curve tracers, and oscilloscopes to ensure proper equipment operation
  • Position, align, and adjust components for proper fit & function
  • Provide troubleshooting assistance and perform electrical repairs or adjustments as necessary
  • Assist engineering by making recommendations for design considerations as it pertains to equipment configuration
  • Maintain accurate records of labor hours and materials used
  • Perform all other duties and tasks as assigned

Requirements:

  • Strong ability to read and interpret electrical schematics and drawings
  • Minimum 1-3 years' experience in the field of electrical assembly, electrical controller assembly, or small circuit wiring
  • PLC assembly, programming, and troubleshooting knowledge
  • Must possess a strong electrical and mechanical skill set
  • Ability to use basic hand tools such as wire strippers, crimpers, drills, taps, screwdrivers, hammers, etc.
  • Working knowledge of 120, 240, 480VAC as well as 24VDC control systems
  • Working knowledge of NEC and UL 508a wiring practices
  • Must possess strong attention to detail and a desire to produce quality work
  • A self-propelled attitude that embraces responsibility

Physical Requirements:

  • Must have good vision and dexterity
  • Must be able to sit throughout the day for extended periods of time
  • Must be able to work with small components
  • Must be able to lift 50 lbs.

Company Background:

Founded in 1968, Applied Energy Systems is the premier gas delivery equipment and service provider to the semiconductor, photovoltaics, R&D, and government industries, as well as a contract manufacturer specializing in precision welding services for the medical, precision instrumentation, and other critical industries. As a growing manufacturing company serving thousands of customers domestically and worldwide, we form long standing relationships with our clients, providing them with the equipment and services they need to succeed.

Applied Energy Systems is an equal opportunity/ affirmative action employer.

Applied Energy Systems Inc is an EEO employer - M/F/Vets/Disabled

title: Deburring/Assembly Technician - Medical Device
job_description:
Why Join the Acero Precision Team?

Acero Precision, located in West Chester, PA is an industry leading Medical Device contract manufacturer producing the very best in precision engineered components. To succeed in today’s manufacturing industry- with its demands to serve customers in a truly global environment- we rely on three vital resources: the newest engineering technologies, quality systems, and most importantly highly-skilled people. We invite you to become a member of an organization that has established an outstanding reputation for quality and excellence. Highly competitive wages, a state-of-the-art-facility, an emphasis on work/life balance, career advancement, a team-centered workplace culture, and the opportunity to be your best is waiting for you at Acero Precision.

Our company promotes an environment that allows for continuous growth and promotion opportunities!

What We Offer

  • 1st Shift: Premium Hourly Rate
  • 2nd Shift: Premium Hourly Rate, Plus 15%
  • 3rd Shift: Premium Hourly Rate, Plus 30%
  • Overtime
  • 100% Employer Paid Medical Plan
  • Dental / Vision Benefits
  • Work-Life Services Benefit Program (Employee + Family)
  • Group Life Insurance
  • 401k retirement plans with employer match
  • Personal Time Off (PTO)
  • Holiday Pay
  • Relocation Assistance
  • Professional Development
  • 100% Paid Uniforms

What You Will Do

  • Must be mechanically inclined!
  • Deburring is a finishing process that removes the sharp edges, burrs, and inconsistencies from materials like metals, steel and alloys. The result is a smooth edge and fine finished surface.
  • Ensure that parts are cleaned and deburred to quality standards.
  • Use hand tools and machinery to perform deburring and finishing tasks.
  • Clean parts to customer satisfaction.
  • Communicate recommendations for process improvement.
  • Complete inspection forms and related documentation.
  • Successfully assemble multi-component parts per blueprint specifications with minimal exposure to fall outs.
  • Coordinates with assembly supervisor in order to meet daily department goals.
  • Assures proper final assembly in order to generate final reports necessary for certificate of conformance creation.
  • Coordinate with the Quality Assurance Department to ensure that all quality standards are met, and to communicate any issues to assembly supervisor.
  • Enforce and maintain special procedures and requirements, such as assembly instructions and packaging, on a job-to-job basis. organizing and cleaning workstations daily, including the computer, and assembly fixtures.

Who You Are

  • High school diploma/GED required
  • 2 + years of Assembly experience
  • Experience with quality control processes

Skills & Competencies 

  • Strong commitment to detail and error-free performance.
  • Have a mechanical aptitude. (Specific to manufacturing floor employees).
  • Basic mechanical skills, including hand tools and their proper use.
  • Ability to read and interpret drawing requirements.

Acero Precision is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Acero Precision does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

Principals only. Recruiters please do not reply to Acero Precision job posts. All applications and/or contact information submitted are kept on file and property of Acero Precision. Please note recruiting fees will not be honored when candidate application(s) are submitted by recruiter(s) or any other entity other than the actual candidate.

Join a team committed to improving lives!

####  Education

Preferred 

  • High School or better

####  Behaviors

Preferred 

  • Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well
  • Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
  • Team Player: Works well as a member of a group

####  Motivations

Preferred 

  • Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
  • Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
  • Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility
  • Goal Completion: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks

Equal Opportunity Employer  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Precision Assembly Specialist
job_description:
Join a Legacy of Innovation!

Position: Precision Assembly Specialist  
Location: Ivyland, PA (201 Ivyland Rd. Warminster, PA 18974)

Do you see yourself thriving in a dynamic environment where cutting-edge technology meets legacy excellence? Ingersoll Rand, a powerhouse in delivering top-tier industrial solutions, is inviting you to bolster our Williams Assembly team. With 160 years of innovation behind us and an impressive suite of products, we’re geared towards making life better across the globe. Visit irco.com to be part of a future-centered journey.

Your Role:

  • Dive into the heart of product creation by assembling, inspecting, and ensuring products meet stringent standards.
  • Master the art of reading blueprints, understanding technical drawings, and interpreting work orders without missing a beat.
  • Hone your skills with practical tools ranging from wrenches to drills, and embrace challenges like tube bending and soldering to upscale your craftsmanship.

How We Work:  
At Ingersoll Rand, we are driven by an ownership mindset centrally anchored in safety and quality. Engage in practices like:  

  • Continuous material monitoring, ensuring smooth production and efficient teamwork.
  • Quality checks synchronized with ISO standards, diagnosing and resolving assembly defects.

Your Fit:

  • 3+ years in mechanical environments.
  • Proficient in reading and implementing technical documents.
  • Adept in both independent and team settings with a knack for communication.
  • Competence with various hand, pneumatic, and power tools.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:  
Ingersoll Rand is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Why Choose Us?

  • Energize your career with our robust benefits, from health plans to a 401(k) program.
  • Flourish in a culture that embraces individual well-being and community responsibility.

Apply by June 15th via our website and initiate your journey with Ingersoll Rand!

title: Laborer
job_description:
Here at Global- a 1st Flagship Company (www.globalfirstflagship.com), a woman-owned small business, we believe in Individual Accountability, Growth, Integrity, and Respect. We are a leader in Marine Support Services and Emergency Management. Serving as the Department of Navy's trusted Prime Contractor since 1964, we embark on a thrilling mission, managing, operating, and maintaining the U.S. Navy Inactive Ship fleet across diverse locations, including Philadelphia, Bremerton, California, and Hawaii. The journey begins here, and we invite you to set sail with us and make a real impact in our dynamic and innovative work environment!

Buckle up for an adrenaline-fueled journey on military vessels such as destroyers, aircraft carriers, and an array of other awe-inspiring Navy vessels! Your golden opportunity for an exhilarating career is knocking - are you ready to answer the call? The journey begins here - with Global- a 1st Flagship Company, we are currently looking for a Laborer.

What You'll Be Doing:

  •     •       • Ties up vessels, cleans piers, vessel / craft decks, hulls, holds, compartments, engine rooms, magazines, bilges, and tanks. Performs vessel and craft preservation.
      • Prepares surfaces for preservation using chipping hammer scaling tools, hand scrapes, power equipment, and deck cleaning machines.
      • Applies proper preservation using paint brushes and paint rollers. Applies sealing compounds using hands, brush, or caulking tools.
      • Pumps tanks and bilges, installs and connects sump pumps, air driven reciprocating pumps, suction and discharge hoses.
      • Shall have physical strength and stamina required to resist the vibrations of pneumatic tools which operate on 90 pounds of compressed air pressure.
      • Assists Mechanical and Electrical trades as required.
      • Assists in rigging and attaching, hoisting and pulling gear.
      • Act as a Fire Watch during Hot Work evolutions.
      • Act as part of a riding crew and receives and moors or casts off vessels/craft at the facility.
      • Assigned to escort visitors including museum groups, military, subcontractors and government representatives as required.
      • Must qualify to wear a respirator.
      • May be required to travel up to 25% to conduct company business.
      • Must be familiar with the Standard Operating Procedures pertaining to environmental protection.
      • Adhere to all corporate core values, policies and procedures in the execution of all responsibilities.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

Minimum Qualifications:

Be able to follow written and verbal instructions. Must be able to work with a team.

  • Be able to demonstrate proper connection/assembly, adjustment and operation of electrical, mechanical and pneumatic equipment used for preservation and maintenance of vessels within 90 days of hire
  • May be required to qualify as a Fire Watch
  • May be required to qualify as a High Reach operator
  • May be required to qualify as a Forklift operator

Preferred Qualifications:

  • One-year previous Maritime or General Labor experience.
Driver's license 

Benefit Highlights Include:

  • Comprehensive Medical (Blue Shield PPO), Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • 11 Paid Holidays Per Year
  • 17 Days PTO/Sick Time Per Year
  • Matching 401K (50% Match up to 8%)
  • Employer Paid Life Insurance & Short Term/Long Term Disability
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Employee Assistance Plan (EAP)
  • Pet Insurance

Global- a 1st Flagship Company is an E-Verify and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Electro-Mechanical Assembler
job_description:
Are you looking for a team that cares about you?

Compression Components & Service, LLC often know by CCS (part of Operio Group) is a fast-growing and family-owned company that provides support services to tablet press end users including control systems, spare parts, training and field service.

We are seeking a skilled Electro-Mechanical Assembler to join our manufacturing team. The successful candidate will be responsible for assembling, testing electrical and mechanical components, parts, and systems to create high-quality finished products. The ideal candidate should have experience in electrical and mechanical assembly, strong attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced production environment.

Travel Requirement: This position requires travel to customer sites to perform installations, calibrations, troubleshoot issues, and conduct repairs on equipment.

Our ideal new colleague will not only be capable of hitting the targets and goals, but they will also be a friendly and driven individual who shares or can align with our values:

Creating a community through bettering ourselves, having integrity, being supportive, and caring.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Read and interpret blueprints, schematics, and technical drawings to understand the assembly process.
  • Assemble mechanical components and systems according to specifications, using hand tools and power tools as required.
  • Assemble electrical components, control panels and machine wiring per electrical schematics, using hand tools and electrical meters.
  • Check the accuracy of parts and components to ensure they meet specifications.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve problems with the assembly process as needed.
  • Follow safety procedures and guidelines to ensure a safe working environment.
  • Mechanical assembly of machinery components and subassemblies.
  • Utilize electrical and pneumatic schematics, prints, and work instructions.
  • Perform installations and calibrations at customer sites when needed.

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Complete set of hand tools, toolbox and digital multimeter.
  • Experience in mechanical and electrical assembly preferred.
  • Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics, pneumatic, technical drawings and blueprints.
  • Experience using hand tools, power tools and digital multimeter.
  • Good manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination.
  • Attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Good problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to work well in a team environment.
  • Willingness to learn and follow instructions.
  • Ability to read and understand English.
  • Ability to travel for customer installations, calibrations and equipment repairs.

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds.
  • Ability to stand, bend, and stoop for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to wear personal protective equipment as required.

Pay: $20-40/hr depending on education, experience, and skills.

Benefits:

  • Develop Your Skills and Grow - We have ever-growing internal training courses and encourage you to take courses externally. We have supported or currently support our team members financially with language courses, driving lessons, part-time degrees/masters, qualifications, and more.
  • Join a Team That Really Cares - Everyone is friendly, collaborative and driven. We are a family business and we care about each other so because of this, you will always be pushed to become the best you can be.
  • Annual Pay Reviews
  • Real Work-Life Balance - 30 days vacation, incl holidays, per year. That's right, 30.
  • And More!

title: Materials Handler- 1st shift
job_description:
The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world’s leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products, and is a steward of luxury and prestige brands globally. The company’s products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: Estée Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, M·A·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD, and BALMAIN Beauty.

##  Description

Material Handlers perform any of the required functions in the Distribution Area to ensure that all daily requirements are met. Activities include supplying assembly and filling lines with components and transfer finished goods out of production.

Material Handlers are expected to perform material handling activities in a manner consistent with manufacturing department's goals and objectives, while adhering to workplace safety policies and procedures. Each Estee Lauder Co. employee will practice an individual commitment to sustainability and environmental responsibility in the workplace.

We aim to steer society in a more sustainable direction for our benefit and the benefit of generations to come.

Position Responsibilities:

⁃ Loads and unloads materials shipped to and from interplant and outside facilities.

⁃ Verify the accuracy of any transactions and compare it to what was actually produced, including physical inspection of goods to validate condition.

⁃ Operate manual and power material handling equipment to retrieve, putaway and replenish materials throughout the facility and load onto transportation vehicles.

⁃ Utilize Warehouse management systems to document and process shipping and receiving orders.

⁃ Ensure correct pallets are used and built based on EXACTA and Customer supplier criteria.

⁃ Assist in maintaining inventory accuracy and stock control as required.

⁃ Troubleshoot and communicate problems to ensure timely turnover in shipping/sortation area.

⁃ Complete a Pre⁃Shift Checklist on all powered material handling equipment including battery water, charging, and cleaning.

⁃ Maintain a clean work environment, including sorting pallets, wrapping stacked cardboard on pallets, and communicating any quality changes.

⁃ Follow all safety and good manufacturing practices (GMP's).

⁃ Perform various other duties as assigned including assisting with the training of new employees.

##  Qualifications

⁃ Education: High school diploma or equivalent

⁃ Experience: Some experience in general warehouse environment preferred

⁃ Proficient computer skills and ability to navigate Basic Microsoft Windows Suite (i.e. Word, Excel, Outlook)

⁃ Forktruck certification mandatory after 90 days

⁃ Effective communication skills and demonstrated knowledge of English, reading and writing.

⁃ Must obtain a Powered Material Handling Equipment (PMHE) License

⁃ Mechanical Aptitude

⁃ Medium physical effort required

⁃ Lifting 50 lbs. maximum and frequently lifting and carry up to 35 lbs.

⁃ Ability to stand for several hours daily.

⁃ Problem⁃solving ability ⁃ Attention to detail

title: Fluid Systems Assembler
job_description:
Responsible for the manufacture of hydraulic machinery from drawings. Must be capable of performing the following duties: 

  • Read hydraulic and electrical circuit and general arrangement drawings.
  • Understand a bill of material and its relationship to a drawing.
  • Layout and assemble hydraulic components using hand-held tools.
  • Fabricate tubing, piping, and hose assemblies using hand-held and bench-mounted equipment.
  • Drill and tap holes using hand-held and bench-mounted power tools.
  • Weld carbon steel and stainless steel plates and piping.
  • Assist in testing all manufactured assemblies.
  • Paint manufactured assemblies if needed.

Relies on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job. Primary job functions do not typically require exercising independent judgment. Reports to the Shop Foreman. 

Requirements:

  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • High school diploma or graduate equivalency diploma (GED)
  • 2-5 years of experience reading hydraulic, electrical circuit, and general arrangement drawings and bills of material preferred
  • Welding and painting experience is preferred, a weld test will be performed
  • A valid driver’s license is required if the employee will be transporting goods by car or truck
  • Onsite training is required to perform job duties that involve operating and/or using tools, machinery, or equipment

Benefits:

  • Medical/Dental/Vision/Disability effective first of the month after the hire date
  • PTO accrual begins upon hire
  • Referral bonuses
  • 100% employee-owned plus 401k with company match

title: Mechanical Assembler/Brazer
job_description:
Scientific Products, an ATS Company is expanding our team and has an immediate opening for a Mechanical Assembler/Brazer in our Warminster, Pa location! The hours for this position are Monday thru Thursday 6am to 3pm and Fridays 6am to 12pm.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Prepare and assemble various segments of mechanical systems and top-level assemblies as well as lower-level components and sub-assemblies under the direction of the immediate supervisor.
  • Interpret and use drawings, process procedures and other written documentation to complete preparation and assembly of components.
  • Fabricate simpler components using various items including hand tools, power tools, fixtures, jigs, drills, taps, saws and other tools and tooling.
  • Form, prepare and align copper, brass and plastic piping along with associated bracketing and hardware.
  • Braze, solder and bond piping as may be required. Mount various assemblies and components.
  • Perform required metal treatment processes per documented procedures and work instructions; processes include polishing, painting, and passivation.
  • Meet documented specification requirements and quality standards in a cost effective and timely manner.
  • Use various types of material handling equipment including hand trucks, carts, forklifts, scissor lifts, cranes, etc. where required and available.
  • Maintain a neat, clean and organized work area. Suggest changes for improved operations and cost savings.
  • Complete paperwork accurately and in a timely manner as required in the manufacturing process such as: Time and Attendance Sheets, Assembly Routers, Non-conformance Records and Test Records.
  • Follow all safety policies, precautions, recommendations and procedures as may be applicable.
  • Assist other production departments or operations areas based on workloads and needs. Assist in other non-production areas as may be required by supervision and management.

Qualifications and/or Experience

  • Welding, soldering and brazing experience or certification a plus.
  • Fork Truck Driver's License a plus.
  • Technical School a plus.
  • Previous experience a plus.
  • The employee is regularly required to lift up to 50 pounds.

WHAT WE OFFER:

  • Enjoy a steady work schedule Monday through Friday with generous time off and 10 paid holidays throughout the year.
  • Opportunities for advancement for those that are up for a challenge!
  • Build your skills while working with state-of-the-art manufacturing equipment.
  • Plan for your future with a generous 401k package including company match.
  • On the job training!
  • Competitive compensation package.
  • A robust health and welfare benefits package that includes Life, Health, Dental, Vision.

EEO and Affirmative Action Statement:  
SP is an Equal Opportunity Employer, dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis and takes affirmative action to ensure equal employment opportunities. It is our policy to provide our employees and applicants with equal employment opportunities in accordance with applicable laws and not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, marital status, sex, gender identification, sexual orientation, genetic information, political belief, pregnancy, citizenship, handicap or disability, status as a veteran or member of the U.S. military, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. SP's Affirmative Action Plan is available through the HR Department and may be accessed during normal business hours.

Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision:  
SP will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information.

title: Mechanical Assembler
job_description:
Mechanical Assembler  
Warminster, PA   
$18 - $25/hour  
Direct hire opportunity!  

Kelly Services, in partnership with our growing client who specializes in customer manufacturing, is seeking a Mechanical Assembler to join their team. The Mechanical Assembler will be responsible for the layout and fabrication of components using schematics to cut and/or weld components from raw metal materials to create finished products. Additionally, the assembler will be involved in assembling various mechanical components for custom equipment.  

Key Responsibilities:

  • Partner with production and engineering teams to ensure system requirements are achieved.
  • Interpret and follow process flow and engineering diagrams.
  • Construct metal components based on engineering drawings using devices such as saws, plasma cutters, and basic power tools.
  • Mount fabricated and acquired mechanical components utilizing lifts or hoists if needed, including shafts, levers, and bearings.
  • Put together packaged components which include modular insulated room panels.
  • Adhere to safety protocols and practice 5S and Lean techniques.
  • Travel as needed for certain tasks.
  • Perform additional duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • At least two years of experience in the manufacturing or assembly of commercial equipment.
  • Mechanical aptitude and general building skills.

  • Good understanding of machines and tools including their design, function, repair, and upkeep.
  • Capable of operating independently, with guidance, and as part of teams.
  • Eager to grow and develop; a background in construction is a bonus.
  • Experience in welding carbon, stainless, and aluminum sheet, pipe, and tube using MIG or TIG machines is advantageous.

If you have a passion for mechanical assembly and fabrication, and are ready to join a dynamic team, we encourage you to apply!  

As part of our promise to talent, Kelly supports those who work with us through a variety of benefits, perks, and work-related resources. Kelly offers eligible employees voluntary benefit plans including medical, dental, vision, telemedicine, term life, whole life, accident insurance, critical illness, a legal plan, and short-term disability. As a Kelly employee, you will have access to a retirement savings plan, service bonus and holiday pay plans (earn up to eight paid holidays per benefit year), and a transit spending account. In addition, employees are entitled to earn paid sick leave under the applicable state or local plan. Click here for more information on benefits and perks that may be available to you as a member of the Kelly Talent Community.
